wikipedia_page.main: Julian Heward Bell (4 February 1908 – 18 July 1937) was an English poet, and the son of Clive and Vanessa Bell (who was the elder sister of Virginia Woolf). The writer Quentin Bell was his younger brother and the writer and painter Angelica Garnett was his half-sister.  His relationship with his mother is explored in Susan Sellers' novel Vanessa and Virginia.
